body_html:
Take a look at the source code of tf.train.SessionManager. In order to restore all the checkpoints listed in the "checkpoint" file, and hence to delete the old ones during the next run, they use something like this:

ckpt = tf.train.get_checkpoint_state(checkpoint_dir)
saver.restore(sess, ckpt.model_checkpoint_path)
saver.recover_last_checkpoints(ckpt.all_model_checkpoint_paths)
body_text:
Take a look at the source code of tf.train.SessionManager. In order to restore all the checkpoints listed in the "checkpoint" file, and hence to delete the old ones during the next run, they use something like this:
ckpt = tf.train.get_checkpoint_state(checkpoint_dir)
saver.restore(sess, ckpt.model_checkpoint_path)
saver.recover_last_checkpoints(ckpt.all_model_checkpoint_paths)
body:
Take a look at the source code of tf.train.SessionManager. In order to restore all the checkpoints listed in the "checkpoint" file, and hence to delete the old ones during the next run, they use something like this:
```python
ckpt = tf.train.get_checkpoint_state(checkpoint_dir)
saver.restore(sess, ckpt.model_checkpoint_path)
saver.recover_last_checkpoints(ckpt.all_model_checkpoint_paths)
```
